“ No one may be arrested otherwise than on the basis of a judicial decision or a prosecutor 's order . ”

“ When there are sufficient grounds for believing that an accused person may evade an inquiry , preliminary investigation or trial or will obstruct the establishment of the truth in a criminal case or will engage in criminal activity , as well as in order to secure the execution of a sentence , the person conducting the inquiry , the investigator , the prosecutor or the court may apply one of the following preventive measures in respect of the accused : a written undertaking not to leave a specified place , a personal guarantee or a guarantee by a public organisation , or placement in custody . ”
Article CARDINAL - Order and decision on the application of a preventive measure

“ Upon application of a preventive measure a person conducting an inquiry , an investigator or a prosecutor shall make a reasoned order , and a court shall give a reasoned decision specifying the criminal offence which the individual concerned is suspected of having committed , as well as the grounds for choosing the preventive measure applied . The order or decision shall be notified to the person concerned , to whom at the same time the procedure for appealing against the application of the preventive measure shall be explained .
A copy of the order or decision on the application of the preventive measure shall be immediately handed to the person concerned . ”

“ Placement in custody as a preventive measure shall be effected in accordance with the requirements of LAW concerning criminal offences for which the law prescribes a penalty in the form of deprivation of freedom for a period of DATE . In exceptional cases , this preventive measure may be applied in criminal matters for which a penalty in the form of deprivation of freedom for a period of DATE is prescribed by law . ”

“ A period of detention during the investigation of offences in criminal cases may not last longer than DATE . This time - limit may be extended by DATE by a district or municipal prosecutor ... if it is impossible to complete the investigation and there are no grounds for altering the preventive measure . A further extension DATE from DATE of placement in custody may be effected only in cases of special complexity by a prosecutor of a subject of GPE ...

An extension of the time - limit for such detention beyond DATE shall be permissible in exceptional cases and solely in respect of persons accused of committing serious or very serious criminal offences . Such an extension shall be effected by a deputy of ORG ( up to one year ) and by ORG ( DATE ) . ”

Section CARDINAL of the Rules regarding the passport of a citizen of GPE adopted by LAW . CARDINAL of DATE provides that the passport of a citizen represents the basic document proving the citizen 's identity on the territory of GPE .
Pursuant to LAW , the passport shall contain information about the citizen 's residence , liability to military service , marital status , minor children , issue of other identity documents .

Section CARDINAL provides that the passport of convicted persons and persons remanded in custody shall be seized by investigating authorities or a court and adduced to the case file . When the citizen is released , the passport shall be returned .
Article CARDINAL of LAW of DATE establishes that residing without a valid passport or residential registration shall be punishable with an official warning or a fine .

ORG No . CARDINAL of DATE , concerning the rules of residential registration , establishes a fine of CARDINAL times the minimum wage if residential registration can not be shown , and CARDINAL times the minimum wage in case of repeated violations .
